title: When a match guard indirectly contains `if let`, rustc requires only the `let_chains` feature and not also `if_let_guard`
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

If you compile the following code:
```rust
fn main() {
    match true {
        _ if let true = true => {}
        _ => {}
    }
}
```
rustc complains as expected:
```rust
error[E0658]: `if let` guards are experimental
 --> src/main.rs:3:11
  |
5 |         _ if let true = true => {}
  |           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: see issue #51114 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/51114> for more information
  = help: add `#![feature(if_let_guard)]` to the crate attributes to enable
  = help: you can write `if matches!(<expr>, <pattern>)` instead of `if let <pattern> = <expr>`
```
[Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=baca9fde049777b0efc7a99c9049638c).

However, if I use the `let_chains` feature, by e.g. wrapping the `let true = true` in parentheses, or adding another clause, it compiles without error:
```rust
#![feature(let_chains)]

fn main() {
    match true {
        _ if let true = true && true => {}
        _ => {}
    }
}
```
[Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=8506b6cc5d3a0ff825bf2542fe2702ff).

It depends only on the `let_chains` feature, instead of both `let_chains` and `if_let_guard`.

This is because here:

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/523be2e05da322daaecf1ecc8f2c0d625f5f46e3/compiler/rustc_parse/src/parser/expr.rs#L2393-L2398

We only gate it under `if_let_guard` if the `let` is directly under the guard node.
